    • Field Detail

      • name

        protected java.lang.String name
        The name of the table for which the references are stored.

      • root

        protected DBSchema root
        The root schema object - the schema which is being referenced from This is really an arbitrary designation since both schemas 'root' and 'reference' can be read by the same table (i.e. the table is bidirectional/cross-referencing). The 'root' schema is just the schema which we are examining with emphasis. For example (to clarify the above): if you load a schema 'abc' into your current BLDB window, and schema 'abc' has a reference field for another schema, 'def', then 'abc' would be the root schema, and 'def' would be the reference shema.

      • reference

        protected DBSchema reference
        The reference schema object - the schema which is being referenced This is really an arbitrary designation since both schemas 'root' and 'reference' can be read by the same table (i.e. the table is bidirectional/cross-referencing). The 'root' schema is just the schema which we are examining with emphasis. For example (to clarify the above): if you load a schema 'abc' into your current BLDB window, and schema 'abc' has a reference field for another schema, 'def', then 'abc' would be the root schema, and 'def' would be the reference shema.

      • label

        protected java.lang.String label
        the label for the text field

      • choice_list

        protected transient javax.swing.JList choice_list
        The list containing the data.

      • indices

        protected int[] indices
        The list of indices selected

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReferenceField

        public ReferenceField(java.lang.String name,
              DBSchema root,
              DBSchema reference)
        Creates a new instance of a reference field. This version of the constructor is used by the FieldGenerator class
        Parameters:
        name - the database key of the current field
        root - the root schema to reference from
        reference - the schema to reference

      • ReferenceField

        public ReferenceField(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String label,
              DBSchema root,
              DBSchema reference)
        Creates a new instance of a reference field. This version of the constructor is used by the FieldGenerator class
        Parameters:
        name - the database key of the current field
        label - the label to display representing the parameter to be manipulated by the text field.
        root - the root schema to reference from
        reference - the schema to reference

      • ReferenceField

        public ReferenceField(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String label,
              java.lang.String rootTable,
              KeyableField rootKey,
              java.lang.String tableRef,
              KeyableField keyRef,
              DBField refName)
        Creates a new instance of a reference field.
        Parameters:
        name - the database key of the current field
        label - the label to display representing the parameter to be manipulated by the text field.
        rootTable - the table from which the reference comes
        rootKey - the primary key of the table from which the reference comes
        tableRef - the table to reference
        keyRef - the primary key of the table to reference
        refName - the column in the reference table to display

    • Method Detail

      • view

        public void view(java.sql.Connection conn,
        java.awt.Container parent,
        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> results)
        Displays the content of a field within a dataset entry. The dataset entry is represented by the object 'results'. The display mode is for viewing purposes, and does not let the user edit the entry content.
        Specified by:
        view in interface DBField
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection to use for any further queries
        parent - the parent container to add components to for displaying the field
        results - the object containing all of the fields and values for a given database entry

      • edit

        public void edit(java.sql.Connection conn,
        java.awt.Container parent,
        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> results)
        Displays the content of a field within a dataset entry. The dataset entry is represented by the object 'results'. The display mode is for editing purposes, and allows the user to edit the content of the field.
        Specified by:
        edit in interface DBField
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection to use for any further queries
        parent - the parent container to add components to for displaying the field
        results - the object containing all of the fields and values for a given database entry

      • schemaEditor

        public java.awt.Component schemaEditor(java.sql.Connection conn,
                              javax.swing.JFrame mainFrame)
        Displays the current field in an editor panel. This method was copied and adapted from displayEdit in SimpleWidget (BioLegato ver. 0.7.9)
        Specified by:
        schemaEditor in interface DBField
        Parameters:
        mainFrame - a JFrame object for any editor popup windows to be modal to
        conn - a database connection object - for reference fields
        Returns:
        a component object representative of the current widget.

      • dbpcdout

        public void dbpcdout(int scope,
            java.lang.Appendable out,
            boolean isKey)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the DBPCD representation of the database field to a writer object
        Specified by:
        dbpcdout in interface DBField
        Parameters:
        scope - the level of scope to write the database field.
        out - the writer object to output the PCD code.
        isKey - whether the field is the primary key for the current schema
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • save

        public java.lang.String save(java.lang.String keyvalue)
        Returns the SQL command(s) or fragment(s) necessary to save the current database field. This function is exclusively called by DBSchema.
        Specified by:
        save in interface DBField
        Parameters:
        keyvalue - the value for the database key (null if it is a new entry)
        Returns:
        the SQL command(s) or fragment(s) - for DBSchema

      • editWindow

        Parameters:
        dest - the destination to display the widget-editing components
        Returns:
        the action listener associated with updating the current widget

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String newValue)
        Changes the current default value for the widget. Reference fields cannot be currently set using 'setValue' - therefore calling this method will produce an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        newValue - the new default value for the widget.
